sen.j: そのため、寛文9年2月18日に江戸幕府は京都・大坂の経済的影響力の観点から、現行の京枡をもって統一した公定枡とすること、全国66国を東西に分割して東側を江戸枡座が西側を京枡座が管掌し、それぞれに京枡の独占的製造・販売権・検定権を与え、偽の枡の製造販売を厳罰に処することとした（「京枡統一令」）。
sen.e: Considering the economic influences in Kyoto and Osaka, the Edo bakufu, in the name of 'Kyo-masu toitsurei' (regulations of unifying Kyo-masu unit), determined to designate the existing Kyo-masu as official and to divide 66 kuni (provinces) around the country into the east and west so that the east and the west would be in charge of the Edo masu-za and the Kyo masu-za, respectively, each having the rights of exclusive manufacture, sale and screening of Kyo-masu, which allowed for severe punishment on manufacture and sale of fake masu.
